attributes.action: Repair pot holed roads by introduction of vignette system for foreign drivers
attributes.background: Many countries in Europe make road users pay to use motorways and major roads, either by way of tolls or a vignette system. I propose introducing a Vignette system in the UK for foreign drivers which would raise revenue to be shared amongst the counties and used solely for repairing road surfaces.
attributes.additional_details: Pot holes in UK roads are increasing due to councils lack of funds for repairs. This causes serious safety issues for drivers and cyclists and can cause major damage to vehicles.

attributes.action: Make garden bonfires and any external fires illegal without a permit.
attributes.background: Bonfire smoke is a health risk for people with asthma & breathing problems. Wind will distribute smoke over a wide area, especially in steep sided valleys. It is a basic human right to have access to clean, breathable air. Environmentally safe waste disposal is universally available in the UK.

attributes.action: Raise the Penalty for Uninsured Motorists
attributes.background: Currently the penalty for driving a motor vehicle with no insurance is £300 and 6 points on your license. With this being the case, millions of motorists take the gamble!
attributes.additional_details:
If you are involved in a road traffic accident that was not a fault of your own, usually the third party’s insurance would cover the damage to your vehicle and your insurance excess. If however, the third party is an uninsured driver, this then falls on you to recover your costs. 

Millions of motorists are uninsured because the penalty for doing so is not severe enough. A £300 fine is cheaper than most annual insurance quotes!

The fine should be more severe to prevent this from happening.

attributes.action: Referendum on whether to scrap the TV license
attributes.background:
A choice to remove the BBC's outdated and unfair, politically biased,  monopoly, by scrapping its license fee.

This decision should be put to the country in a Referendum with the question "Do you want to keep paying for the BBC License? Yes or No"

attributes.action: Stop roll out of "Academies" to SEN schools.
attributes.background: Stop rolling out academy schools to SEN Schools. How can a private company do better? It's all about money. How can a shared head teacher have lead in the school? The situation is wrong. The government want to pass schools on, reduce budgets and then blame someone else for the schools doing bad.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to smoke within 10 metres of a dwelling if it is hotter than 25C
attributes.background: In the summer, due to global warming, temperatures now regularly reach 30 - 35C. This is extremely hot and it is simply insulting to expect people to not open their windows because inconsiderate people are smoking outside their house.
attributes.additional_details:
I personally have been hugely affected by this issue. Smokers pollute the environment and contribute to global warming. They also severely harm others with second hand smoke, especially children. 
Children are often unable to play in the garden in the summer due to the noxious gases being emitted from the smoke, this causes a deficiency in vitamin D. This law will apply to all areas (public or residential) unless the owner of the properties affected allows them to smoke. Penalty: £400 - 6 months

attributes.action: Give anyone who has a long-term health condition medication on the NHS
attributes.background:
Some people end up needing hospital treatment because they cannot afford their medication. 

Health officials say they have made sure people with chronic illnesses have access to affordable prescription but the current system is arbitrary and unfair.
attributes.additional_details: People with Diabetes have their medication and equipments on the NHS but what about people who have the leading cause of death being Heart Disease in the UK/World-wide? Conditions such as Heart Disease, Crohns or Parkinson's etc should be available on the NHS, doing this could save thousands of lives.

attributes.action: Increase armed forces budget
attributes.background: We believe that the armed forces are receiving too little in budget and pay. and we believe that they should get more money due to the fact that everyday their life is put on the line.

attributes.action: Ban the use and sale of all non-recyclable plastics in the UK by 2025
attributes.background:
Plastic is a direct threat to the long term survival of all species, with the amount of plastic pollution in the oceans and land expanding at a catastrophic rate.
HM Government's strategy on plastic waste is inadequate in its current form and must be reviewed to ban all harmful plastics by 2025.

attributes.action: Invite Vladimir Putin to the UK to discuss UK-Russia relations
attributes.background:
Britain's most famous Prime Minister Winston Churchill said "Jaw Jaw is better than War War". 
If he refuses to come it will speak volumes. If he does come maybe we can avert a tit-for-tat escalation.

attributes.action: Urgent review of Business Rates for Small Businesses
attributes.background: Business Rates in this country are driving existing Businesses into debt and liquidation, preventing them from expanding and new Businesses from forming. The extortionate cost of Business Rates are set far too high and there is very little help available and no incentive for Local Councils to help
attributes.additional_details: To run a Business, premises are often required. Different types of Businesses have different requirements. For example, a Small Office Business may run with low Business Rates and a high turn-over. Where as a Small Manufacturer may require a much larger premises, huge Business Rates, and have a smaller profit margin. We need a fairer and balanced Business Rates system that works for the different types of Businesses, because at the moment it is killing our Small Businesses and preventing growth

attributes.action: Make snow days a compulsory paid day off
attributes.background: We are asking the government to make snow days a compulsory paid day off we ask that under a amber warning for snow that if you cannot get into work or the company that you work for does not trade that we are paid for it

attributes.action: Examine viable options for nationalising Thames Water.
attributes.background: In March 2018 up to 20,000 London households suffered an unplanned interruption in their water supply.  This lasted several days and caused significant hardship and distress. It was likely due to vital infrastructure being unable to cope with adverse weather conditions due to underinvestment.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/jan/09/nationalise-rail-gas-water-privately-owned

https://www.theguardian.com/business/nils-pratley-on-finance/2017/nov/24/thames-water-explains-why-nationalisation-is-suddenly-popular

https://www.telegraph.co.uk/business/2017/07/01/thames-water-bows-ofwat-pressure-chairman-heads-exit/

https://www.ofwat.gov.uk/ofwat-statement-thames-water-leakage-commitments/

https://www.theguardian.com/business/2017/nov/30/thames-water-ofwat-performance

attributes.action: Bring Home The QE2
attributes.background:
The QE2 was the last of the great liners build on Clydeside. 
In 2008 it was sold to a company in Dubai, since then it has been sitting in a dock rotting with no work been carried out on it.
I think the British Government should purchase the ship and bring it back to the Clyde. Where it Belongs.

attributes.action: Stop schools being able to confiscate phones for more than the shool day.
attributes.background: Many schools confiscate phones if they are seen or heard. However the problem arises when schools confiscate a phone overnight or sometimes over multiple days. Kids should have right to bring their phones to school and also take them back at the end of the day.
attributes.additional_details: Our school has created a rule where if any phone makes a noise or is seen during the school day (including break) it will be confiscated and you will have to collect at the end of the following day. This is also the case in many other schools. Due to kids signing a 'home school agreement' which apparently gives them the right to do this. The government should assign rules that restrict schools from being allowed to take phones over night.

attributes.action: Allow non-UK citizens to vote in general elections after 5 years of UK residence
attributes.background: We want all non-EU/non-commonwealth citizens living in the UK to have full voting rights (including in general elections) after 5 years of residence. In order to create a truly representative government we must include the opinions of these people who make up approximately 8% of the UK population.
attributes.additional_details: I recently discovered that non-EU citizens are ineligible to vote in UK general elections, and on further research that non-commonwealth citizens have no voting rights at all. It seems wrong that people who have lived and worked in the UK for a considerable period have no say in their futures. There has been a drastic increase in hate crimes towards foreigners in the UK since the Brexit vote, and making them more a part of our society can only help to make them feel more welcome.

attributes.action: No transfer of powers to councils to fine motorists for minor traffic offences
attributes.background: Town halls want to rake in more cash by securing sweeping new powers to impose fines on motorists for minor traffic offences.  The Local Government Association want government to transfer powers to them that are currently only available to the police.
attributes.additional_details: The Local Government Association have already started the process of lobbying government in the form of the Department of Transport.  They believe that they are better suited to this enforcement than the police.  This has already been rejected once, but they are continuing to put pressure on government for the change.  We already know that local government isn't about making things safer it's purely a revenue raising exercise and again the motorist is yet again being seen as a cash cow.

attributes.action: Ban credit checks for job applications
attributes.background: Most jobs now require credit checks. All of us have a past - should we be judged on our credit? does it affect our ability to work?
attributes.additional_details: The majority of people have at least one debt or more, especially trying to survive on benefits.

attributes.action: Make sending sexual photo/film with or WITHOUT intent to cause distress illegal
attributes.background:
Section 33 of Criminal Justice and Court Act 2015
1)It is an offence for a person to disclose a private sexual photograph or film if the disclosure is made
(a)without the consent of an individual who appears in the photograph or film, and
(b)with the intention of causing that individual distress.
attributes.additional_details:
In section (8) the law says: "A person charged with an offence under this section is not to be taken to have disclosed a photograph or film with the intention of causing distress merely because that was a natural and probable consequence of the disclosure"

This law creates a loophole for criminals who did not consider their victim's reaction or the probable consequences of disclosure. The law needs to be reworded to 'with or without intent to cause distress' as the victim suffers despite intent

attributes.action: Free residential or nursing care for everyone who fought during WW 2.
attributes.background: People who risked their lives for our country are now forced to give up everything to pay for their care.

attributes.action: Remove VAT from home insulation and damp proofing products.
attributes.background:
Home insulation, damp proofing and draught exclusion are the top three most effective and simple means of reducing energy cost and emissions whilst improving environmental health.
Charging VAT on insulation, damp proofing and draught exclusion is hobbling those who do most to help the environment.
attributes.additional_details:
The laws of physics and the governments own agencies agree with the priorities for energy efficiency and reduction of environmental cost/ damage.
Removal of VAT would be the single, simplest and most effective action whilst avoiding the high administration cost of the more complex and corruptible schemes.

attributes.action: Require all schools to teach children about the severity of acid attacks.
attributes.background: We have recently seen increasing numbers in the amount of these life-changing acid attacks. For example, in 2012 the attack of Naomi Oni, who had acid chucked on her whilst walking through London. Since, 2012 acid attacks have doubled. It is vital that we educate children about this danger.
attributes.additional_details: Last year there were more than 450 acid attacks in London alone. Many have argued to make the sale of acids more regulated and that you should no longer to be able to 'buy it over the counter' however I do not think this is how we should tackle this problem. By further regulating the sale of acids we will not stop the problem directly, however by educating our youth on the effects of these life-changing attacks, we will hopefully see a decrease in the number of attacks in areas such as London.

attributes.action: Remove Parabens,Artificial Colour,Flavour & Preservatives from Infant Medication
attributes.background: Make all pharmaceutical companies removed parabens, all artificial colours, flavours and preservatives currently found in liquid medications, primarily used by parents for young children and especially babies. Babies should definitely not be exposed to parabens in this way.
attributes.additional_details:
Parabens have been proven to adversely affect the reproductive systems in rats and have no place in childrens medications

There is evidence that parabens and para- hydroxybenzoic acid may act as oestrogenic endocrine disruptors. Source below:
http://www.breastcanceruk.org.uk/science-and-research/parabens/
http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/ruth-romano/parabens-and-breast-cance_b_15963020.html
They should not be contained in product given to babies i.e. immature reproductive system/pre puberty

attributes.action: Have Friday , Saturday and Sunday as a day of for all school children.
attributes.background: Going to school can be a mentally and physically demanding process and I believe children need an extra day off every week.
attributes.additional_details: I always have always  struggled mentally and physically demanding going to school five days a week.

attributes.action: suspend work on smart motorways & use the money to repair the carriageways
attributes.background: Millions of pounds are being spent on smart motorway upgrades, yet a lot of the road surfaces are in a very poor condition. There are  potholes & sunken lanes everywhere. I propose that the money allocated to smart motorways should be used to bring the road surfaces up to a standard fit for purpose.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for supermarket chains to display air miles on fruit.
attributes.background: Fresh fruit often travels to the UK by air, which creates huge amounts of CO2. People need the information on packaging to make choices and reduce their CO2 footprint.
attributes.additional_details:
Many people do not realise the CO2  of their food, especially when it travels by air. Aeroplanes are huge contributors to climate change.
Providing the air travel information on fruit packaging would give people the tools to reduce their CO2 footprint, and help us stop climate change.

attributes.action: Make Public Company Directors Personally Liable for Company Failures
attributes.background: In the UK we have created a corporate environment where Company Directors are rewarded for success and failure. This is different for SME owners where risk taking is offset by the potential of losing everything, including their home. We believe such rules should apply to Corporate Directors.
attributes.additional_details:
We believe that there needs to be greater accountability by Public Company Directors. We believe there needs to be a change to corporate law where, to be a Company Director of a PLC (or any company on a public share exchange), individuals have to provide personal securities commensurate with the financial rewards. These securities should extend to pension provisions.
By introducing a personal element of risk to Senior Executives, irresponsible risk taking will be eliminated in our major PLCs.

attributes.action: Enlarge the area eligible for high cost area supplements for NHS staff
attributes.background:
The cost of living in South East England in areas such as Brighton and Hove is now on par with London. 

NHS staff in these areas are struggling to meet the basic costs of living such as rent, food and travel. We propose extending the fringe area eligible for high cost area supplement to Sussex.

attributes.action: Scrap English language (IELTs) test for spouse visa
attributes.background: UK has introduced English language test (Ielts), for the family members of British citizens without which its imposible to join them in the uk. I am personally affected by this as I have two kids under the age of 3 and I can’t bring them to the uk because their mum is unable to speak English.
attributes.additional_details: I hope this law is changed which will make it possible for thousands of families around the uk to be united with Their loved ones.I think it’s unfair for a war-torn country like Afghanistan which has been and is in war since 1978, how can the uk government expect such uneducated population to read and write their own language let alone speak English.

attributes.action: Ban knives longer than 4 inches.
attributes.background:
No person needs a knife longer than 4 inches. If this law is passed then the UK will have a reduction in crime. 
Please sign the petition to make the UK a safer place.

attributes.action: Hold a Royal Commission on the future funding of the NHS and Adult Social Care
attributes.background: With the merging of the NHS and Adult Social Care briefs, now is the time to hold a Royal Commission on the future direction of a funding model for the NHS and Adult Social Care.
attributes.additional_details:
The NHS and Adult Social Care briefs have recently been merged.
With ever increasing pressure on our NHS and Adult Social Care budgets, now is the time to look at a long term solution for funding, training and investment in the long-term future direction of the NHS and Adult Social Care. 
A Royal Commission should be established with a medical professional chairing it to take opinions from professionals and experts on how to take the NHS and Adult Social Care forward.

attributes.action: Make 'traffic light' food/drink labelling legally compulsory in the UK.
attributes.background:
One often reads, hears or sees in the news these days that obesity levels in the UK
have reached pandemic proportions,
leading to concerns about the risk of heart disease and diabetes, among other serious and life-changing illnesses.
attributes.additional_details: A big contributing factor is the amount of excess fat, saturated fat, salt and sugar consumed by the average UK citizen on a daily basis. There is a clear system available called the "traffic lights", whereby food and drink items can be rated using red (high), amber (medium) and green (low) images to simply and clearly indicate how much fat, saturated fat, salt and sugar are contained in 100 grams or 100 millilitres of an item. As I understand it use of the traffic lights is currently voluntary.

attributes.action: Remove variable speed cameras or only put them in action for emergencies
attributes.background: The removal of the variable speed cameras would cut congestion dramatically it will also prevent as many crashes in these areas from people slamming their brakes on when they approach a ridiculous 40mph
attributes.additional_details: When the cameras have been off over Christmas no traffic at all on the m4 past Newport at the same time when the cameras are in action you can expect tailbacks that also cause high emissions from stop start traffic caused by these variable limits they should either be removed or only used if there are lanes blocked

attributes.action: Hold a referendum to decide if the public agree with the deal made with EU
attributes.background:
Hold a referendum for the public to decide whether we the people accept the deal made between the government and the EU for Britains exit from the union.

The referendum must only decide between:
leave with the deal that's presented.
or 
leave with no deal.
There must be no option to remain.

attributes.action: Make employers specify a minimum salary on all job adverts
attributes.background: UK average salary increases insufficient as living costs continue to rise sharply. Job seekers deserve transparency. Companies offering 'competitive' salaries complicate the process of finding employment and hinder job seekers from comparing potential income and making an informed choice.
attributes.additional_details:
If companies are forced to advertise a minimum salary it becomes easier for a job seeker to determine the suitability of a certain position. It cuts the inefficiency of time and money spent on applications with no hope of employment and helps to ensure employers can't widen already established pay gaps, offer job seekers a deserved level of clarify and transparency.

https://www.ons.gov.uk/employmentandlabourmarket/peopleinwork/earningsandworkinghours

attributes.action: Put a revenue tax on all retail sales in the UK.
attributes.background: At the moment our retailers are losing out to the big conglomerates, who pay little or no Corporation tax in the same proportion as UK based companies.
attributes.additional_details: Amazon and Google are prime examples and some food and coffee chains use similar global means to reduce their UK taxes-particularly corporation tax. The Corporation tax could then be replaced by the new revenue tax on goods and services sold in the UK.

attributes.action: Parliament to require all minibus drivers to have a special minibus license
attributes.background: Current law allows drivers with a car licence to drive vehicles with seating capacity between 9 and 16 seats under certain circumstances (see below) without the need for a vocational licence or specialised training thereby putting the lives of passengers at risk. This must be stopped!
attributes.additional_details:
Amongst the conditions that need to be met in order to drive a minibus (with up to 16 seats) with a car driving licence include the following: 
'you’re driving on a voluntary basis and the minibus is used for social purposes by a non-commercial body.
the maximum weight of the minibus is not more than 3.5 tonnes - or 4.25 tonnes including specialist equipment for disabled passengers, for example a wheelchair ramp."

However these are blatantly being abused and our children's lives are at risk!

attributes.action: Ban import of all Burmese products to the UK
attributes.background:
Discriminatory government policies and militry violance in Mayanmar have compelled 600,000 Rohingya's to fled their homes to Bangladesh.

Violations of human rights, including burning villages, killings, raping, torturing women & children, ethnically cleansing Burma of Rohingya population.
attributes.additional_details:
Rohingya are Muslim minority group. They differ from Myanmar’s dominant Buddhist groups ethnically, linguistically, and religiously.

The government refuses to grant the Rohingya citizenship, as a result they have no legal documentation, effectively making them stateless. Myanmar’s 1948 citizenship law was already exclusionary, and the military junta, which seized power in 1962, introduced a law twenty years later stripping the Rohingya of access to full citizenship.

attributes.action: Give tax breaks to parents who support their children through university
attributes.background:
I am supporting my daughter through university. 
Why not treat these payments in the same way as gift aid? , reimburse my daughter the 20% tax on the value that I've paid to her?

attributes.action: Set up a UK Sovereign Wealth Fund
attributes.background:
The shale gas industry could give the UK an opportunity to do things better this time and put those funds aside for future generations.

Rather than investing in Gilts - pension companies should encourage investment in this fund to be used for major infrastructure  opportunities.
attributes.additional_details: Instead of squandering future revenue from this initiative like we did with oil in the 1970’s - invest the lot and build up a capital sterling reserve.

attributes.action: Lower the price of road tax for petrol and increase the price for diesel
attributes.background: It is said that Diesel cars emit more harmful pollutants, why should road tax be so much cheaper for diesel? it only encourages more people to use diesel.

attributes.action: To be compulsory for dog owners to muzzle their dogs if using extendable lead
attributes.background: A cat on my street was sleeping on his windowsill an elderly lady came onto the street with her dog on one of these leads. The dog was at least 15ft in front of lady went between a car saw the cat and fatally attacked and killed the cat, because she didn't have full control of her animal.

attributes.action: Protect private companies and pension funds by closing Companies Act loopholes.
attributes.background: Under s172 Companies Act 2006, directors must "promote the success of the company" taking into account the long term consequences and the need to act fairly with stakeholders, such as employees.  However, Part 23 of the Act fails to prevent the asset-stripping of companies by the unscrupulous.
attributes.additional_details:
Accumulative distributable reserves should be restricted to cover the current pension fund deficit before further distributions are considered. 

Fixed assets should be recorded at fair value before assets are transferred out of the company and the non-distributable revaluation reserve created should remain with the company.

Non-distributable reserves converted to distributable reserves should be accounted for as unrealized profit for dividend purposes and not appropriated from the company.

attributes.action: Make private ownership of reptiles and amphibians a criminal offence.
attributes.background: Three quarters of all pet reptiles dies within a year, that is around six millions animals. Having reptiles and amphibians as pets is cruel because they suffer in captivity and cannot be looked after properly.

attributes.action: Fine* patients who do not attend (DNA) NHS hospital appointments.
attributes.background:
DNAs: 
- Cost the NHS an estimated £225 million in 2012 to 2013° 
- Result in extended waiting lists 
- Are an inefficient use of staff 
- Occurred in around 5.6 million (9% of the total) NHS outpatient appointments in England between 2014 to 2015°° 
(See additional details for sources °and°°)
attributes.additional_details:
Appointments where a patient does not show or provide prior notice are regarded as DNAs (did not attend). 
*To reduce DNAs, provide an incentive from as little as a £1 circumstantial charge to encourage patients to cancel. Thus freeing a space for those who can attend the appointment.
°Source: The National Audit Office 
°°Source: Quarterly Hospital Activity Data, 2015
Additional information:
https://www.gov.uk/government/news/hospitals-and-patients-urged-to-take-action-on-missed-appointments

attributes.action: Introduce a 10% maximum limit on a university's intake from independent schools.
attributes.background: 7% of children in Britain go to an independent school. In this age of soaring inequality, the fact that around 40% of offers of a place at Oxbridge, and around 25% from the Russell Group of top universities, go to these students is simply shocking. It is 2017, not 1917. Enough is enough.
attributes.additional_details:
Despite promises from the top universities to improve their systems for admissions, figures released by MP David Lammy, show the situation to be worsening. 82% of offers from Oxford and 81% from Cambridge went to students from the top two socio-economic groups in 2015, up from 79% at both universities five years earlier.* 

The government must act. A withdrawl of public funding, plus significant fines for offending institutions should be implemented immediately.

*The Guardian 19 10 2017

attributes.action: Raise awareness of germ spreading by licking fingers to open bags/give out paper
attributes.background: Many stores have staff who decide to lick their fingers to make it easier to open carrier bags. This is a serious health and safety issue as it can cause the spread of illnesses and diseases. It is very unhygienic and disgusting and shouldn't be the norm. They can use water instead.
attributes.additional_details: Licking fingers is also often done within schools, organisations and institutions where they give out papers, forms and applications etc. The UK Government needs to launch an awareness campaign to help stop this unhygienic practice.

attributes.action: Teach Self-defense as a national curriculum
attributes.background: offer free self-defense lessons for free for children under the age of 18. This will possibly help with bullying and improve fitness

attributes.action: Subsidy on "free from" products for people with food allergies
attributes.background: After having a child who is food intolerant to several things including dairy, wheat and fish & meeting several people in similar positions who all struggle to get anything on prescription, I want to petition for the Government to provide a subsidy for these expensive but necessary items.

attributes.action: Change the A1 license - Motorcycle
attributes.background: My suggested change is if you are 18+ Years old and obtain an A1 license you can ride a motorcycle up to a 300cc with no power greater than 23 kw (30 bhp) Restrictions can be placed on the bike. This will give people an incentive to obtain this license. Making more people do motorcycle training.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently you can obtain an A1 license at 17+ Years old Which allows you to ride a motorcycle up to a 125cc with no more power of 11kw (15 bhp) you no longer display L plates, you can carry a pillion and have access to the motorway. 

Cbt allows you to ride a motorcycle up to a 125cc with no more power of 11kw (15 bhp) as long as you display L plates front and back, don’t Carry pillions and don’t go onto the motorway.

17 year olds have no restriction on what car they can drive after passing.
